pageContext.description: Cutting edges blunt and chipped, one very considerably. Wings of the blades symmetrical; however on socket rather elongated at the ends in its wider part.,Chemical Analysis (B.M. Laboratory, Nov. 1937) gave these figures, so might be called copper rather than bronze.
pageContext.patina: Origionally dirty greenish black more golden-brown after BM Laboratory treatment.
pageContext.collection: British Museum, 1933.4-6.126,BRM Dept. Rept. In Bequest of R Garraway Rice, Exp, F.S.A., received April 1933; has been in his collection since January 1913 - see statement on label quoted opposite.
pageContext.site: England,Devon,Topsham,'Found by a labourer circa. 1911 while digging "in a market garden near Mount Howe, Topsham, Devon, about 4 miles from Exeter"; came into possession of H. Wilson HOlman, Esq., FSA during Summer 1912, who presented it to the under-signed in January 1913. R. Garroway Rice, FSA',(Label in Mr. Rice's hand on hand to which axe was fixed in his collection - preserved in British Museum as document.)
pageContext.remarks: CF. Specimen of similar shape from Whitby, N.R. Yorks.,AOK (Section)
